# isPaused

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the view’s scene animations are paused.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var isPaused: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

If the value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the scene’s content is fixed onscreen. No actions are executed and no physics simulation is performed.

When an application moves from an active to an inactive state, [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKView/isPaused] is automatically set to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. When an application returns to an active state, [doc://com.apple.spritekit/documentation/SpriteKit/SKView/isPaused] is automatically set to its previous value.

## Controlling the Timing of a Scene’s Rendering

- **preferredFramesPerSecond**: The animation frame rate that the view uses to render its scene.
- **delegate**: A delegate that allows dynamic control of the view’s render rate.
- **SKViewDelegate**: Methods to take custom control over the view’s render rate.
- **frameInterval**: The number of frames that must pass before the scene is called to update its contents.
- **preferredFrameRate**
